page.title: 06Religion-St Mary's Church
page.content: The church is the most important feature of our village.It stands upright in the middle of the village for all to see.The church is made of chalky white stone from Tadcaster quarries.It is crumbling and cracking. On the outside there are gargoyles.They are made of stone and are covered in moss and bird droppings.Some windows are made from coloured glass.The church has big steel doors that have rust round the edges.The graveyard surrounding the church is in two parts.One is very old dating back a long way and the other is quite new. Inside the chancel,where the choir and clergy sit,is an ancient {misericord.}However the most important feature of the church is its{spire which is reputed to be the tallest spire of a parish church in the north.
